news_header: The European Research Council's Syn.y Grant funding is awarded to humanities in Finland for the first time, recognizing the importance of medieval literary culture in the Nordic region.
news_text: For the first time, the European Research Council's Syn.y Grant funding has been awarded to a humanities project in Finland, led by Tuomas Heikkilä. This project, CODICUM, explores the medieval literary culture of the Nordic countries and its connections to Europe. The funding, worth EUR 13 million, highlights Finland's role as a leader in humanistic research. The project aims to provide a multidimensional view of history by combining various research methods, including bioscience and artificial intelligence, to understand the development of literary culture and its impact on modern identity in the Nordic region.
